classes module

class classes.Interactive(filename)[source]

Bases: object

Manages the core game loop, logic, and state updates.

This class handles player movement, collisions, item usage, rock pushing, and win/loss conditions.

Parameters:

filename (str) – The path to the map file to load.

playing_map

The current state of the game grid.

Type:

list[list[str]]

player_loc

The current (x, y) coordinates of the player.

Type:

tuple

axes_loc

List of coordinates where axes are located.

Type:

list

fires_loc

List of coordinates where flamethrowers are located.

Type:

list

mushroom_count

Total mushrooms required to win.

Type:

int

current_mushroom

Number of mushrooms collected so far.

Type:

int

held_items

The item currently held by the player (‘x’, ‘*’, or None).

Type:

str or None

state

The game state. True = Win, False = Loss, None = Playing.

Type:

bool or None

pick_up_message

A message string displayed to the user after actions.

Type:

str

handle_movement(move, silent=False, delay=False, multi_move=False)[source]

Processes a single movement command from the player.

This method calculates the next position, checks for collisions (walls, water, rocks, trees), handles interactions (pushing rocks, cutting trees), and updates the game map and visual display.

Parameters:

  • move (str) – The direction key (‘W’, ‘A’, ‘S’, ‘D’, etc.).

  • silent (bool, optional) – If True, suppresses console output (used for testing). Defaults to False.

  • delay (bool, optional) – If True, adds a small time delay for animation effects. Defaults to False.

  • multi_move (bool, optional) – Indicates if the move is part of a sequence. Defaults to False.

Returns:

This method modifies the class attributes in-place.

Return type:

None

handle_pickup()[source]

Attempts to pick up an item from the tile the player is currently standing on.

If the player is on a tile that contained an item (‘x’ or ‘*’) before they stepped on it, and they are not currently holding an item, this method equips the item.

class classes.Locations(filename)[source]

Bases: object

Handles the initialization and scanning of entities within the map.

This class is responsible for parsing the raw map grid to find the starting positions of the player, items, and objectives.

Parameters:

filename (str) – The path to the map file.

items_loc

A tuple containing two lists: - index 0: list of coordinates for axes (‘x’). - index 1: list of coordinates for flamethrowers (‘*’).

Type:

tuple

mushroom_count

The total number of mushrooms (‘+’) on the map.

Type:

int

player_loc

The (row, col) coordinates of the player (‘L’).

Type:

tuple or None

playing_map

The mutable 2D grid of the game map.

Type:

list[list[str]]

r

The number of rows in the map.

Type:

int

c

The number of columns in the map.

Type:

int

count_mushroom()[source]

Scans the map to count the total number of mushrooms (‘+’). Updates self.mushroom_count.

find_L()[source]

Scans the map to find the player’s starting position (‘L’). Updates self.player_loc.

find_items()[source]

Scans the map to find item locations. Updates self.items_loc with coordinates of axes (‘x’) and flamethrowers (‘*’).

class classes.Map(filename: str)[source]

Bases: object

Represents a game map file handler.

filename: str

The path to the text file containing the map layout.

get_map() → list[list[str]][source]

Reads the map file and converts it into a grid (2D list).

Returns:

A 2D list representing the game grid, where each element is a single character string representing a tile.

Return type:

list[list[str]]

Raises:

ValueError – If the specified filename does not exist.
